long_desc.thetext:
Not a real bug, only a request for upgrading to the new version.

Actual release:
2010-11-07a.tgz “Anteater” (dokuwiki-0-0.8.20101107.a.el5.noarch.rpm)

Expected results:
2011-05-25 "Rincewind" with hotfixes applied


TIA for taking care of this.

Well, I have been able to install dokuwiki-0-0.8.20110525.a.el5 after removing 
dokuwiki-selinux-0-0.8.20101107.a.el5 to solve a dependency problem:

dokuwiki-selinux-0-0.9.20110525.a.el5.noarch from /dokuwiki-selinux-0-0.9.20110525.a.el5.noarch has depsolving problems
  --> Missing Dependency: policycoreutils-python is needed by package dokuwiki-selinux-0-0.9.20110525.a.el5.noarch (/dokuwiki-selinux-0-0.9.20110525.a.el5.noarch)

The new version seems ok and my testing was without problems so I would give good karma after the problem on dokuwiki-selinux has gone.

Thank you again Andrew.

bugs.title: CVE-2011-2510 dokuwiki: XSS in DokuWiki's RSS embedding mechanism

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2011-2510 dokuwiki: XSS in DokuWiki's RSS embedding mechanism

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that DokuWiki's RSS embedding mechanism did not properly
escape user-provided links. An attacker could use this flaw to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, potentially leading to arbitrary
JavaScript code execution.

References:
[1] http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=631818
[2] http://www.certa.ssi.gouv.fr/site/CERTA-2011-AVI-366/CERTA-2011-AVI-366.html
[3] http://www.freelists.org/post/dokuwiki/Hotfix-Release-20110525a-Rincewind

Solution:
This issue has been addressed in upstream "2011-05-25 Rincewind" release:
[4] http://www.dokuwiki.org/changes

This issue affects the versions of the dokuwiki package, as shipped with
Fedora release of 14 and 15.

--

This issue affects the versions of the dokuwiki package, as present within
EPEL-5 and EPEL-6 repositories. Please schedule an update.

CVE Request:
[5] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/06/28/5

Created dokuwiki tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: epel-all [bug 717148]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 717149]

The CVE identifier of CVE-2011-2510 has been assigned to this issue:
http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/06/29/13

bugs.title: CVE-2011-3727 dokuwiki: installation path disclosure via a direct request to a .php file

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2011-3727 dokuwiki: installation path disclosure via a direct request to a .php file

long_desc.thetext:
Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures assigned an identifier CVE-2011-3727 to
the following vulnerability:

Name: CVE-2011-3727
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-3727
Assigned: 20110923
Reference: http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/06/27/6
Reference: http://code.google.com/p/inspathx/source/browse/trunk/paths_vuln/%21_README
Reference: http://code.google.com/p/inspathx/source/browse/trunk/paths_vuln/dokuwiki-2009-12-25c

DokuWiki 2009-12-25c allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive
information via a direct request to a .php file, which reveals the
installation path in an error message, as demonstrated by
lib/tpl/index.php and certain other files.

Created dokuwiki tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: fedora-all [bug 741385]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 741386]
Affects: epel-5 [bug 741387]

bugs.title: CVE-2012-3354 dokuwiki: Full path disclosure with PHP error level enabled

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2012-3354 dokuwiki: Full path disclosure with PHP error level enabled

long_desc.thetext:
A full path disclosure flaw was found in the way DokuWiki, a standards compliant, simple to use Wiki, performed sanitization of HTTP POST 'prefix' input value prior passing it to underlying PHP substr() routine, when the PHP error level has been enabled on the particular server. A remote attacker could use this flaw to obtain full path location of particular requested DokuWiki page by issuing a specially-crafted HTTP POST request.

References:
[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/06/24/2
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/06/25/2

This issue affects the versions of the dokuwiki package, as shipped with Fedora release of 16 and 17. Please schedule an update (once final upstream patch available).

--

This issue affects the versions of the dokuwiki package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL 5 and 6. Please schedule an update (once final upstream patch available).

Created dokuwiki tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: fedora-all [bug 835149]
Affects: epel-all [bug 835150]

After updating to this version I get an error in the browser, e.g. using URL http://localhost/dokuwiki/doku.php displays (without '-----'):

----------------------------
DokuWiki Setup Error

The mediaolddir ('media_attic') does not exist, isn't accessible or writable. You should check your config and permission settings. Or maybe you want to run the installer?
----------------------------

Fedora 17 x86_64

Note that I installed dokuwiki-selinux package, which I did not have previously. May this be a reason for the issue?

Installed:
  dokuwiki-selinux.noarch 0:0-0.12.20120125.b.fc17                                                                                                               

Updated:
  dokuwiki.noarch 0:0-0.12.20120125.b.fc17                                                                                                                        

Complete!
# service httpd restart
Redirecting to /bin/systemctl restart  httpd.service
#
Sorry about messed up formatting above -- copy&paste from terminal was not too great :(
Uninstalling dokuwiki-selinux didn't fix the issue. Downgrade to dokuwiki-0-0.11.20110525.a.fc17.noarch made the wiki work again.

The following commands are needed to make dokuwiki-0-0.12.20120125.b.fc17.noarch work:

# mkdir /var/lib/dokuwiki/data/media_attic
# chown apache.apache /var/lib/dokuwiki/data/media_attic
# mkdir /var/lib/dokuwiki/data/media_meta
# chown apache.apache /var/lib/dokuwiki/data/media_meta

After this manual fix I was able to successfully view my dokuwiki pages and edit them. Shouldn't new package create those directories?

bugs.title: CVE-2012-0283 dokuwiki: XSS flaw in tpl_mediaFileList()

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2012-0283 dokuwiki: XSS flaw in tpl_mediaFileList()

long_desc.thetext:
Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures assigned an identifier CVE-2012-0283 to
the following vulnerability:

Name: CVE-2012-0283
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-0283
Assigned: 20111230
Reference: http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2012-24/
Reference: http://bugs.dokuwiki.org/index.php?do=details&task_id=2561

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the tpl_mediaFileList
function in inc/template.php in DokuWiki before 2012-01-25b allows
remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the ns
parameter in a medialist action to lib/exe/ajax.php.

Created dokuwiki tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: fedora-all [bug 840687]

A new version of Dokuwiki is ready:

http://www.splitbrain.org/projects/dokuwiki

dokuwiki-2012-01-25b
